sn35.32:4.1: “Mendicants, I will teach you the practice that’s conducive to uprooting all identifying.
sn35.32:4.3: And what is the practice that’s conducive to uprooting all identifying?
sn35.32:5.1: What do you think, mendicants? Is the eye permanent or impermanent?”
sn35.32:7.1: “But if it’s impermanent, is it suffering or happiness?”
sn35.32:9.1: “But if it’s impermanent, suffering, and liable to fall apart, is it fit to be regarded thus:
sn35.32:9.2: ‘This is mine, I am this, this is my self’?”
sn35.32:13.1: “The pleasant, painful, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by eye contact: is that permanent or impermanent?”
sn35.32:15.1: “But if it’s impermanent, is it suffering or happiness?”
sn35.32:17.1: “But if it’s impermanent, suffering, and liable to fall apart, is it fit to be regarded thus:
sn35.32:17.2: ‘This is mine, I am this, this is my self’?”
sn35.32:24.1: The pleasant, painful, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by mind contact: is that permanent or impermanent?”
sn35.32:26.1: “But if it’s impermanent, is it suffering or happiness?”
sn35.32:28.1: “But if it’s impermanent, suffering, and liable to fall apart, is it fit to be regarded thus:
sn35.32:28.2: ‘This is mine, I am this, this is my self’?”
sn35.32:30.1: “Seeing this, a learned noble disciple becomes disillusioned with the eye, sights, eye consciousness, and eye contact.
sn35.32:30.2: And they become disillusioned with the painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by eye contact.
sn35.32:30.3: They become disillusioned with the ear … nose … tongue … body …
sn35.32:30.5: They become disillusioned with the mind, phenomena, mind consciousness, and mind contact.
sn35.32:30.6: And they become disillusioned with the painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by mind contact.
sn35.32:30.9: When freed, they know ‘it is freed’.
sn35.32:30.10: They understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual life has been lived, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’
sn35.32:30.11: This is the practice that’s conducive to uprooting all identifying.”
